column1: glassesanddreads 152975050638 "2016-11-10 01:32:01 GMT" http://glassesanddreads.co.vu/post/152975050638/click-here-to-support-viris-continuing-recovery "blood-and-violets:Hello y'all. Iâ€™m Viridian
column2: a lower-class white intersex trans woman living in Portland
column3: Oregon. In late September I held a fundraiser for my recovery from top surgery which was scheduled for the middle of October. I had met my goal and had planned out very carefully every aspect of how I would spend the money
column4: both leading up to the surgery with preparations and throughout my recovery by covering food and rent. I have been unemployed and wasnâ€™t able to pursue employment with an impending surgery involving a recovery period of several weeks. The money from the fundraiser is basically my lifeline until Iâ€™m well and able to go find work. Unfortunately
column5: I caught a virulent strain of strep in late September and after I took antibiotics I developed an incredibly painful condition where a lymph node on my neck got so enlarged that it began pressing on my inner ear and causing massive pain in my jaw
column6: giving me a fever and night sweats. My tonsils also remained irritated and painful throughout this process making it difficult to swallow and eat. I went to the ER
column8: saw 4 different doctors and finally saw an ENT specialist. I had over 15 blood tests for infectious diseases (all negative) and an incredibly painful biopsy of my lymph node. My primary care doctor forced me to postpone my surgery. The ENT was well convinced that I had Hodgkins Lymphoma and also forced me to postpone my top surgery until he found the root cause of my condition through the results of the biopsy
column9: which turned out to be inconclusive (which is still terrifying to me because I donâ€™t know whatâ€™s wrong). At this point in time Iâ€™m being told itâ€™s unlikely I have cancer
column10: which is immensely relieving. So because of this horrible mess
column11: my surgery was set back by 2 weeks. I decided to just go for it despite my health issues. In the mean time I tried to live as frugally as possible in order to try to save as much of my recovery fund as I could
column12: but this illness set me back so far that my planning has faltered and I need to ask for help again. My surgery happened on November 1st. Iâ€™m currently on my feet and moving but am still in incredible pain and managing it with strong medications. I wonâ€™t be able to work for at least another couple of weeks and Iâ€™m about to become completely broke. If anyone can help me with just a little bit more to carry me through to finding gainful employment I will immensely grateful!Thank you for your time and patience reading this. Please share and boost it!Â " False link
